alert.note: Alert for Redwood (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 12:58PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Redwood County through 130 PM CDT... At 1258 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Wabasso, or 9 miles southwest of Redwood Falls, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Redwood County, including the following locations... Clements, Wanda and Seaforth. This includes U.S. Highway 71 between mile markers 58 and 74. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
